basics.name: vmName
basics.label: VM Name
basics.toolTip: String used as a base for naming resources (6 alphanumeric characters or less).  A unique hash is prepended to the string for some resources, while resource-specific information is appended.

constraints.validationMessage: Resource prefix must be between 2 and 6 characters long, must begin with a lowercase letter, and can contain only numbers and lowercase letters.

basics.name: adminUsername
basics.label: VM user name
basics.toolTip: Admin username for all of the deployed virtual machines.

toolTip.password: VM password must be 12 characters and have 3 of the following: 1 lower case character, 1 upper case character, 1 number, and 1 special character.

basics.name: ipAddressOrSubnet
basics.label: Allowed IP address or subnet
basics.toolTip: Specify a single IP address or subnet.  Only connections originating from these IP addresses will be allowed to access endpoints in this deployment.

constraints.validationMessage: Malformed IP address. Specify as x.x.x.x or x.x.x.x/y where x any number from 0 to 255 and y is any number from 1 to 32

subLabel.preValidation: Define the size and performance of the virtual machine

elements.name: vmStoragePerformance
elements.label: Storage performance
elements.toolTip: Standard storage is backed by magnetic drives and provides the lowest cost per GB. Premium storage accounts are backed by solid state drives and offer consistent, low-latency performance. They can only be used with Azure virtual machine disks, and are best for I/O-intensive applications. This setting can't be changed after the storage account is created. [Learn more](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/#introducing-the-azure-storage-services)
